summary:
The Security Council,
Having considered the report of the 1540 Committee (S/2006/257), reaffirms resolution 1540 (2004) and that proliferation of nuclear, chemical and biological weapons constitutes a threat to international peace and security.

Endorses the 1540 Committee's work, particularly on national reports submitted by States, and recalls that not all States have presented their reports.

Reaffirms that resolution 1540 (2004) obligations shall not conflict with or alter rights and obligations of States Parties to relevant treaties.

Noting full implementation of resolution 1540 (2004) is a long-term task requiring continuous efforts.

Acting under Chapter VII of the Charter,
1. Reiterates decisions in resolution 1540 (2004) and emphasizes importance of full implementation.

2. Calls on States that have not presented a report to submit one without delay.

3. Encourages States to provide additional information on implementation.

4. Extends the 1540 Committee's mandate for two years, until 27 April 2008.

5. Decides the 1540 Committee shall intensify efforts to promote full implementation through a work programme.

6. Decides the 1540 Committee will submit a report on compliance by 27 April 2008.

7. Decides to remain seized of the matter.
